content:
So the surveys are closed and we have to organize the processing of the survey data. There are a few parts of this:

  • Translating survey results into English and collating the data
  • Reading and coding those results into some usable format
  • Trying to shape a story out of the data and look for trends

The first bullet is for all of you wonderful translators to do. The only catch is that I don't quite know how to collate the data usefully -- did we just make copies of the google spreadsheets last time? I don't think I was involved in this part, but I'm sure others remember.

I'm looking into seeing if I can do a contract to handle the second bullet. It's looking like "maybe to probably", I hope to have something setup there soon.

@Ryan Levick mentioned an interest in helping with the third bullet, once that gets underway.
Does that all sound right or am I missing something :)
btw, 6393 English responses
If I'm not mistaken - last year we translated using the spreadsheet results, as a new tab for English version
@Bruno Tavares ok, that workflow makes sense

OK so @stream I would appreciate it if you could update the coordination doc with some notes on the translation status for your language and where to find results. You'll also find the set of folks who volunteered for each language, so maybe you can coordinate with each other to share out the effort.

(Also, apologies for the mass-ping; maybe I should setup a user group for "all translators"...)
@nikomatsakis do you want us to write directly as a list item for our language ?
@Poliorcetics yeah I think that'd be easiest
Done for French then, we also have a [fr] stream here to coordinate

I've completed the [IT] translation of the free-form answers. I don't remember last year how we decided to manage fixed form ones (such as buttlet points). Was it possible to infer the choice from a bullet/check answer even if the question text was in another language? @nikomatsakis do you recall anything about this by any chance? :thinking:
I might go all in and translate anything to be sure it's as close as possible to the English version

While I'm not sure how data exported from Google forms look like, for Simp Chinese version I built a tool csv-translator last year to extract unique answers of each question from csv into a YAML file and then merge the result back into a translated csv. Maybe it can be useful for other languages as well.
interesting tool @Xidorn Quan, I'll check that out - thanks!
Hey folks, is it realistic to have all the translations done by end of next week?
If that's not possible, please say so; I'm not trying to crack the whip, just to establish a date for planning purposes.
By next week do you mean by 11 Oct? For Simp Chinese, I think it's feasible. @Charles Lew and I are making good progress.
It's in the realm of "realistic" to get the Swedish translation done until then, but I'll be able to say more definitively at the end of _this_ week.

Hey @stream, so I was just talking to @Ryan Levick and he's going to take over the coordination role here -- i.e., he'll be checking up on translation status and contacting folks as necessary, as well as helping drive the analysis. So if you get some pings from @Ryan Levick don't be surprised! :heart:
Hey everyone :wave: Looking forward to working with all of you!

Xidorn Quan said:

While I'm not sure how data exported from Google forms look like, for Simp Chinese version I built a tool csv-translator last year to extract unique answers of each question from csv into a YAML file and then merge the result back into a translated csv. Maybe it can be useful for other languages as well.

This is fantastic!!!
I think I don't have access to the shared folder for survey data (avrongru@gmail.com). May I have access to it to start with Russian translation?
Done! :+1:

I've created a spreadsheet to get a good overview of which translations are started, which are not started and which are finished. Please make sure that the spreadsheet correctly reflects your language's status. And please let me know if getting the translation done by the 12th of October seems reasonable to you. :heart:
@Xidorn Quan you mentioned that you've already started the translation, but I don't have a link to the document. Can you add a link to the document in the status spreadsheet?
Also, if possible it would be great to have the translations as a separate sheet tab from the original answers. This will make exporting easier.

As I mentioned before, We're not using a spreadsheet to translate. I developed a tool csv-translator last year for this purpose. This tool transforms the CSV into a more translatable YAML file, and we use a private GitHub repo to coordinate translation.

Actually I'd like to recommend this approach to other languages' team as well, as I find it much more productive and less error-prone than translating inside spreadsheet, and you have more flexibility on the process. For example, we create issues to track what questions need to be translated, and collaborators can assign themselves to the issues so we don't conflict. If some team has enough time and energy, they can even introduce a review process.
Do you plan on uploading the csv to the folder when finished?

I do, but since data of Simp Chinese one isn't from Google Forms, the data arrangement may be a bit different. If we are using spreadsheet I probably need to adjust it a bit before uploading. Last year I just sent the translated CSV file directly to someone :D
We'll need to get the data into the same format as the others so that it can be aggregated. We can coordinate this when you're done with the translation.
I can see there are some differences in format. I'll figure that out. Probably another program would be necessary...
And we're actually quite close to finishing the translation of Simp Chinese now. The current progress is about 37/39 done, with some additional summarizing up stage work.

@QQ @Chiu Hsiang Hsu @Igor Matuszewski just checking in on status. The status sheet says you've not yet begun the translation process. Just wondering if you think having the results done by the 12th of October seems reasonable.
Translation of Simp Chinese answers has all done. I'll look into transforming the result into the same format as English version this weekend.
@Ryan Levick I think Oct 12th would be fine for Vietnamese responses as there are not many, I can start by this weekend.
@Xidorn Quan that workflow with a github repo sounds quite clever :)

Ryan Levick said:

I've created a spreadsheet to get a good overview of which translations are started, which are not started and which are finished. Please make sure that the spreadsheet correctly reflects your language's status. And please let me know if getting the translation done by the 12th of October seems reasonable to you. :heart:

I think Russian translation can be done by October 12.
Do we have English version of result spreadsheet for reference? I see that results of different languages have some minor differences, e.g. on timestamp format.

Xidorn Quan said:

Do we have English version of result spreadsheet for reference? I see that results of different languages have some minor differences, e.g. on timestamp format.

Are you looking for this file perhaps?
Looks like yes, thanks. But what's "Carimbo de data/hora" I wonder :thinking:

the timestamp of when the survey was submitted. I think colums headers are not so important as files will likely be parsed by column number.

For example, we will trust that in any CSV we translators produced the column AX matches the question "What is your experience with other tools you use? [rustdoc or cargo doc]"
Hmmm... it matters for us because I need to ensure that I do have the right columns match up, as Simp Chinese used a different survey system.

I see. I don't have clear why the column name matters but I guess it's not important :-) Like you said, what matters is that at the end you can produce a csv that conforms all the others (in terms of: same column == same question).

Oh gosh, I think I messed up the translation status sheet's permission, https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1rswdGFhzrm3C3i6Y03Gxg8Fg6XXa5bcAOFFYgfIaidA/edit#gid=0

I wanted to work on the responses sheet but ended up editing the wrong sheet.
Can someone help to fix my bad, really sorry? :face_palm:‍♂️ @Ryan Levick @nikomatsakis

QQ said:

Oh gosh, I think I messed up the translation status sheet's permission, https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1rswdGFhzrm3C3i6Y03Gxg8Fg6XXa5bcAOFFYgfIaidA/edit#gid=0

I can edit the "translation status sheet" file and looking at the revision history I don't see any changes.
Which change exactly can't you revert? Which file you wrongly edit?
@Ryan Levick I think 12th Oct will be fine for Traditional Chinese response translation.

apiraino said:

QQ said:

Oh gosh, I think I messed up the translation status sheet's permission, https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1rswdGFhzrm3C3i6Y03Gxg8Fg6XXa5bcAOFFYgfIaidA/edit#gid=0

I can edit the "translation status sheet" file and looking at the revision history I don't see any changes.
Which change exactly can't you revert? Which file you wrongly edit?

I messed up the original sheet's permission, I had to duplicate it to another sheet to edit. I think someone has fixed now. Thanks.

@apiraino It's important to verify any transform I do would be correct. It seems the header of English response is quite poor, there are some header text disappears. I'll probably refer to other languages instead...

@apiraino It seems that you can't really rely on order. For example, the order of question series "How would you rate the difficulty of learning these concepts/topics?" doesn't match between Japanese version and English version. Since all of them have the same answer set, you won't be able to realize it if you simply ignore the header text and use their order. Also cc @tanakakz
Result for Simp Chinese has been processed to match English response format and uploaded to the spreadsheet

Xidorn Quan said:

apiraino It seems that you can't really rely on order. For example, the order of question series "How would you rate the difficulty of learning these concepts/topics?" doesn't match between Japanese version and English version.

Now I see what you mean. I'll have a second look to my version in the following days.
I'm currently translating text area answers only. But found that others did find and replace for all the questions and choices. Will it be ok to keep doing as I do currently?
Ok, almost everyone is doing the translation of everything in the result CSV. Once I'm done with the text area answers, I'll try to do "find and replace" that way.
@Igor Matuszewski I don't believe we've heard from you whether having the translations done by the 12th of October seems reasonable. Let me know if that sounds good to you!
@Ryan Levick sounds good, sorry for replying so late!
No worries! :blush:
Looks like we're on track for everyone getting their translations in by the 12th. I'll check in with everyone on Friday to ensure we're still good to go.
@Ryan Levick done, although it only has 5 responses and the survey was botched for non-users - we only got results from sections 13 and onwards...
hopefully that's still useful.
Thanks! That's a shame, but I think this will still be useful.
@Ryan Levick FYI, the Traditional Chinese translation is done!

German translation is _almost_ finished!
Should I translate countries, states and cities, too, if possible?

Ludwig Stecher said:

German translation is _almost_ finished!
Should I translate countries, states and cities, too, if possible?

Personally I've decided to not translate them (just translated the countries name).

The JP responses has been translated.
Please let me know if any other processing is required.

@Ludwig Stecher @Iñaki Garay Can you please update the status spreadsheet if you're finished with the translations? https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1rswdGFhzrm3C3i6Y03Gxg8Fg6XXa5bcAOFFYgfIaidA/edit?usp=sharing If you're not finished, can you please let me know when you hope to be? The goal was to have them finished by today, but I understand if life got in the way :blush:
@Ryan Levick German translation is finally finished and the status in the spreadsheet is updated.
I noticed that some answers are duplicated. This looks like a bug in Google Forms. Line 21/22 are identical, same with line 175/176. The probability that this is a coincidence is near zero I believe

Ryan Levick said:

Ludwig Stecher Iñaki Garay Can you please update the status spreadsheet if you're finished with the translations? https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1rswdGFhzrm3C3i6Y03Gxg8Fg6XXa5bcAOFFYgfIaidA/edit?usp=sharing If you're not finished, can you please let me know when you hope to be? The goal was to have them finished by today, but I understand if life got in the way :blush:

Sorry for the delay, Spanish is done!
I'm done with Korean translation. This year, over 100 people answered with the Korean version.
This is great news! That means all of our translations are done! :tada:
woot!
Thanks again to all of our translators. This wouldn't be possible without you!

I have a quick question for years to come. Has anybody written a tool to translate questions and non-text area answers back to English in the result spreadsheet? Last year I didn't translate those parts of the result. So this year I underestimated the amount of the effort to do the mapping and it took quite much time actually.
@DH maybe you can have a look at my csv-translator :) https://github.com/upsuper/csv-translator
Thank you, @Xidorn Quan.

I too wrote my own tool in an afternoon, after trying out csv-translator. I really like csv-translator's approach and will give it a closer look next time as well.
The main issue I had was with multiline long answer responses, either the tool, google spreadsheet import or output, or the interaction between them, produced errores in some rows.
Another option is writing either a spreadsheet script in js, or interfacing with the g spreadsheet api
This would constitute a poor man’s translation memory

@Iñaki Garay I just tested some simple data from google spreadsheet, and it seems line breaks just become escaped \n in the yaml, and they are correctly converted back, so it seems to work as expected. But if you do see any issue, please let me know!
